adk.selectorswitch

Class SelectorKnob

  • java.lang.Object
    • adk.selectorswitch.SelectorKnob

  • class SelectorKnob
extends java.lang.Object
    SelectorKnob describes the knob used in the selector switch and has the structure shown here.

    As specified in the diagram, the knob has a set of values that define its structure in form of a path. This path is drawn on the selector switch's canvas when the selector switch is rendered. The selector knob also stores a rotation transformation matrix which is used to rotate it every time the selector switch's mode is changed, as the knob has to point to the correct mode upon the change.

    See Also:
    SelectorSwitch

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int centerX
      Stores the X and Y coordinates of the point about which the knob is rotated.
      private int centerY
      Stores the X and Y coordinates of the point about which the knob is rotated.
      private float currentAngle 
      private static int knobCentralStartingAngle
      Knob has a central starting angle of 230 degrees.
      private static int knobCentralSweepingAngle
      Knob has a central sweeping angle of 260 degrees.
      private static int knobLengthDIP
      Knob has a handle length of 3 DP units.
      private android.graphics.Path knobPath
      Stores the complete structure of the knob and is drawn onto the canvas when the switch is rendered.
      private static int knobRadius1DIP
      Knob has a central radius of 4 DP units.
      private static int knobRadius2DIP
      Knob has an outer radius of 1 DP units.
      private static int notchStartingAngle
      Knob has a notch starting angle of 90 degrees.
      private static int notchSweepingAngle
      Knob has a notch sweeping angle of 180 degrees.
      private android.graphics.Matrix rotationMatrix 
      private float screenDensity
      Stores the density of the screen for converting DPs into pixels.
